name: Orbital changes
label: Earth's orbital changes
title: Is it the Earth's orbit?
sub: No. Although changes in Earth's orbit have been linked to climate change in the past, the effect over the last 125 years is small.

name: Solar
label: Solar temperature
title: Is it the sun?
sub: No. The sun's temperature varies over decades and centuries. But these changes have had little effect on our climate.

name: Volcanic
label: Volcanic activity
title: Is it volcanoes?
sub: No. Erupting volcanoes have a short-term cooling effect.

name: Land use
label: Deforestation
title: Is it deforestation?
sub: Actually, no. When forests are cleared, the land underneath reflects more sunlight than the darker trees. This light bounces off Earth's surface, causing the planet to cool a little.

name: Greenhouse gases
label: Greenhouse gases
title: Is it greenhouse gases?
sub: Yes! The rise in heat-trapping greenhouse gases is the only factor that matches the worldâ€™s warming since 1880.
